skills.name: JavaScript
skills.justification: Alex has used JavaScript (ES6+) extensively in both professional and academic contexts for front-end web and cross-platform app development. This includes over 14 months of daily production use at Northwind Digital Labs, leading the front-end of the Campus Event Explorer team project, and contributing to personal projects such as a responsive course planner and multiple web utilities. JavaScript is described as the 'core language' across roles and projects, implying frequent, complex, and independent use in real-world scenarios.
usedWith: Component library development in React at Northwind Digital Labs (June 2023–Present)
Campus Event Explorer team project (React, Node.js, MongoDB)
Responsive course planner project (vanilla JS, CSS Grid)
Resume site and various JS algorithm snippets

skills.name: React
skills.justification: React is cited as a core technology in Alex's main professional position (Northwind Digital Labs, 14 months including promotion), with responsibilities ranging from building reusable component libraries and authoring documentation to leading accessibility initiatives and implementing cross-platform UI. React is also the front-end backbone of the 'Campus Event Explorer' capstone project. Given the depth of tasks such as library creation, accessibility advancement, and platform-specific logic, Alex demonstrates advanced skills, though the career is still early-stage.
usedWith: Reusable component libraries and design system work at Northwind Digital Labs (June 2023–Present)
Cross-platform UI logic (React web, React Native mobile)
Campus Event Explorer (capstone project, front-end lead)

skills.name: React Native

Alex emphasizes cross-platform UI logic and has shipped and maintained mobile UI, demonstrating more than a learning-phase understanding. Level is estimated as advanced-intermediate given total professional exposure.
usedWith: Cross-platform UI implementation at Northwind Digital Labs (June 2023–Present)

The level reflects frequent, non-expert application and learning curve typical for developers early in their TypeScript journey.
